title: Characterizing Out-of-Distribution Error via Optimal Transport. (arXiv:2305.15640v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Out-of-distribution (OOD) data poses serious challenges in deployed machine learning models, so methods of predicting a model's performance on OOD data without labels are important for machine learning safety. While a number of methods have been proposed by prior work, they often underestimate the actual error, sometimes by a large margin, which greatly impacts their applicability to real tasks. In this work, we identify pseudo-label shift, or the difference between the predicted and true OOD label distributions, as a key indicator to this underestimation. Based on this observation, we introduce a novel method for estimating model performance by leveraging optimal transport theory, Confidence Optimal Transport (COT), and show that it provably provides more robust error estimates in the presence of pseudo-label shift. tldr: 本论文提出了一种基于最优输运理论的新方法 - 置信最优输运(COT)，并且引入了基于经验的变体 - 带门限的置信最优输运(COTT)，它们能够更精确地估计模型的性能，特别是在面对伪标签转移误差时。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel method called Confidence Optimal Transport (COT) based on optimal transport theory for estimating model performance on out-of-distribution (OOD) data, and introduces an empirically-motivated variant of COT, Confidence Optimal Transport with Thresholding (COTT), which can provide more accurate error estimates, particularly in the presence of pseudo-label shift.
